answers: A. The number of vehicles in this lane at any given time
B. The maximum speed limit
C. The minimum speed limit

quizzes.question: This road sign forbids...
answers: A. Delivery vehicles on the second lane.
B. Heavy motor vehicles on the second lane.
C. Construction vehicles on the second lane.

quizzes.question: Where would you find this road marking?
answers: A. On any road in an intersection.
B. On any road with two-way traffic.
C. On one-way roads such as dual-carriageways or freeways to indicate the right edge line.

quizzes.question: How should you respond to a traffic light that displays a steady red arrow?
answers: A. Stop as for a steady red light and only move off when the green light is displayed.
B. Proceed with caution as for a yield sign.
C. Stop behind the line and, if turning right, proceed but give right of way to other vehicles and pedestrians crossing your path.

quizzes.question: Where could you expect to find this traffic signal?
answers: A. On any road, especially in wildlife sanctuaries and rivers.
B. On any road close to water, harbours.
C. At a railway crossing and at a public transportation lane

quizzes.question: What does this flag signal indicate?
answers: A. Vehicles turning to the right may proceed.
B. Slow down and stop before reaching the flagman.
C. Potential hazard ahead. Proceed slowly and be alert.

quizzes.question: What action should be taken when encountering these road markings?
answers: A. Slow down and be ready to leave the freeway in 300m if you want to use the next exit.
B. Drive in such a way that you do not stop, park, or drive over the painted island, unless on the orders of a traffic or police officer, to avoid a collision or in an emergency.
C. Avoid driving to the left of the yellow lines.

quizzes.question: Where would you find this road sign?
answers: A. At the beginning of any road or part of a road.
B. On any road, especially in mountainous areas.
C. In areas where there is mining and industrial activities taking place.

quizzes.question: This part of the road must be used by... only.
answers: A. Animal-drawn vehicles
B. Horses and riders
C. Rickshaws

quizzes.question: Where could you expect to find this road sign and how should you react?
answers: A. On roads with high-incident collision zones. Switch on your vehicle's headlights.
B. In mountainous areas before a tunnel. Switch the lights of your vehicle on in the dip position.
C. On roads that carry large amounts of traffic at night. Switch on your vehicle's headlights.

quizzes.question: What does this road sign indicate?
answers: A. It shows a parking area reserved for airport transfers.
B. It shows a parking area reserved for minibuses from a specific organization or company.
C. It shows a parking area reserved for ambulances or emergency vehicles.

quizzes.question: What should be your reaction when you approach this road marking at intersection or railway crossing?
answers: A. Bring your vehicle to a stop behind the stop line,If there is no stop line, the front of the vehicle must come to a standstill in line with the stop sign.
B. Slow down and drive on when it is safe to do so.
C. Lookout for pedestrians, trains and move on if it is safe to do so.

quizzes.question: What action should be taken when you encounter this command sign?
answers: A. Be on the lookout for police officers on the next 50km.
B. Do not exceed the speed indicated by this sign.
C. Do not drive slower than the speed indicated in km/h.

quizzes.question: What are you expected to do when you approach this road sign?
answers: A. If other traffic is approaching the intersection, reduce speed and, if necessary, stop.
B. If more than one vehicle stops at the intersection, the vehicle which stopped first should move off first.

C. If you intend to carry straight on, bring your vehicle to a standstill behind the stop line. When turning left, yield to all traffic which is close enough to pose a hazard. Proceed only when it is safe.

quizzes.question: What does this road sign command?
answers: A. Only vehicles with exceeding mass should use this part of the road.
B. Delivery vehicles only should use this part of the road.
C. Vehicles carrying dangerous substances only should use this part of the road.

quizzes.question: What action should be taken when you come across this road sign?
answers: A. Stop your vehicle behind the stop line, proceed only when it is safe.
B. Look out for pedestrians crossing the road or near the road and be ready to stop.
C. No stopping for the next 4km.

quizzes.question: This road sign commands what?
answers: A. Proceed right only.
B. Keep right.
C. Keep left.

quizzes.question: What should be your reaction when you approach this road sign ahead?
answers: A. Bring your vehicle to a stop, proceed only when it is safe.
B. Look out for pedestrians crossing the road or near the road and be ready to stop.
C. Stop if the STOP sign is displayed. Proceed with caution if the GO sign is displayed.

quizzes.question: What should you do when you come across this road sign?
answers: A. Keep left.
B. Keep right.
C. Proceed straight only.

quizzes.question: What action should be taken when you come across this road sign?
answers: A. Look out for pedestrians crossing the road or near the road and be ready to stop.
B. If other traffic is approaching the intersection, reduce speed and, if necessary, stop.
C. Proceed only when it is safe.

quizzes.question: What action should be taken when you encounter this command sign?
answers: A. Turn left only.
B. Keep left.
C. Proceed left only.

quizzes.question: What should be your reaction when you approach this road sign at an intersection?
answers: A. Proceed only when it is safe.
B. If other traffic is approaching the intersection, reduce speed and, if necessary, stop.
C. Look out for pedestrians crossing the road or near the road and be ready to stop.

quizzes.question: This road sign commands what?
answers: A. The road or part of the road may be used by cyclists only.
B. The road or part of the road may be used by pedestrians only.
C. The road or part of the road may be used by children only.

quizzes.question: What does this road sign command?
answers: A. Cyclists may not use this part of the road indicated by this sign.
B. Two-wheeled vehicles may use this part of the road.
C. Cyclists may use only the part of the road indicated by this sign.

quizzes.question: What is the purpose of this road sign?
answers: A. To indicate that a freeway begins at the sign and that the rules that apply to freeways are effective from here.
B. To indicate that a single-carriageway freeway begins at the sign and that all rules that apply to freeways are effective from here.
C. To warn you against a height restriction ahead.

quizzes.question: This road sign commands that this part of the road may be used by
answers: A. Cyclists and pedestrians only.
B. Bikers only.
C. Elderly people on bicycles only.

quizzes.question: This road sign informs you of what?
answers: A. The road narrows ahead.
B. A single-carriageway freeway begins.
C. There is a bridge 5 km away.

quizzes.question: Only... are allowed on this part of the road.
answers: A. Midi buses
B. Goods vehicles
C. Emergency vehicles.

quizzes.question: What action should you take when you come across this road marking?
answers: A. Slow down and release your brake before driving over the speed hump.
B. Only drive into this arrestor bed when your brakes fail.
C. Ensure not to cross the prohibition line that follows the sign.

quizzes.question: What does this road sign command?
answers: A. Only buses are allowed to use such road or portion of such road.
B. Only taxis are allowed to use such road or portion of such road.
C. Only delivery vehicles are allowed to use such road or portion of such road.

quizzes.question: What will you come by ahead of this control sign?
answers: A. A traffic circle where you must expect to yield to other traffic.
B. A gentle curve to the right.
C. A U-shaped curve ahead to the right.

quizzes.question: This road sign informs you of what?
answers: A. U-shaped curve ahead to the right.
B. A gently curve ahead to the right.
C. A sharp curve ahead to the right.

quizzes.question: What does this road marking alert you of?
answers: A. Railway crossing ahead.
B. Stop sign ahead.
C. Pedestrian crossing ahead.

quizzes.question: This road sign reminds you of a...
answers: A. Sharp turn ahead.
B. Winding road ahead.
C. Hairpin bend ahead.

quizzes.question: What action should you take when you come across this road marking?
answers: A. Only drive into this arrestor bed when your brakes fail.
B. Slow down if other traffic is approaching the intersection and stop if necessary.
C. Ensure not to cross the prohibition line that follows the sign.

quizzes.question: This road sign warns you of what?
answers: A. A two-way traffic crossroad ahead.
B. A two-way traffic ahead.
C. A traffic circle ahead.

quizzes.question: What is the purpose of these road markings?
answers: A. To warn you that there is a no-overtaking line or no-crossing line ahead.
B. To warn in time that you will be obliged to follow a certain direction at the first intersection.
C. To warn that the traffic lanes are reduced from the left or right or from both sides.

quizzes.question: What action should be taken when you come across this road sign?
answers: A. Do not drive slower than the speed indicated in km/h.
B. Do not exceed the speed indicated by this sign.
C. Do not proceed past the sign or enter the road without special permission.

quizzes.question: What action should you take when you come across these road markings?
answers: A. Ensure not to cross the prohibition line that follows the sign.
B. Choose the correct lane in time to drive in the direction that you want to go.
C. Change lanes in time if the lane you are traveling in ends.

quizzes.question: What does this road sign prohibit?
answers: A. A vehicle which is higher than the height indicated by the sign.
B. A vehicle which has an axle mass that exceeds the mass indicated in tons by the sign.
C. A vehicle which has a GVM or GCM that exceeds the mass indicated in tons by the sign.

quizzes.question: What should be your reaction when you approach this road marking?
answers: A. Drive in the center of your demarcated lane.
B. Slow down and release your brake before driving over the speed hump.
C. Be on the lookout for approaching vehicles.
